q: We suffer for the simple reason that suffering is biologically useful. It is nature's preferred agent for inspiring change.
h:
“We suffer for the simple reason that suffering is biologically useful. It is nature's preferred agent for inspiring change.” —
Mark Manson

q: On the other side of the clouds is a bright blue sky.
h:
“On the other side of the clouds is a bright blue sky.” —
Unknown

q: Truth will always be truth, regardless of lack of understanding, disbelief or ignorance.
h:
“Truth will always be truth, regardless of lack of understanding, disbelief or ignorance. ” —
W. Clement Stone

q: To the mind that is still, the whole universe surrenders.
h:
“To the mind that is still, the whole universe surrenders.” —
Lao Tzu

q: It's beautiful to be alone. To be alone does not mean to be lonely. It means the mind is not influenced and contaminated by society.
h:
“It's beautiful to be alone. To be alone does not mean to be lonely. It means the mind is not influenced and contaminated by society.” —
Jiddu Krishnamurti

q: The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no recipe for living that suits all cases.
h:
“The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no recipe for living that suits all cases.” —
Carl Jung

q: How people treat you is their karma; how you react is yours.
h:
“How people treat you is their karma; how you react is yours. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: You'll see it when you believe it.
h:
“You'll see it when you believe it. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: They say love is the best investment; the more you give, the more you get in return.
h:
“They say love is the best investment; the more you give, the more you get in return.” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: If we all did the things we are capable of doing, we would literally astound ourselves.
h:
“If we all did the things we are capable of doing, we would literally astound ourselves.” —
Thomas Edison

q: Nothing ever goes away until it has taught us what we need to know.
h:
“Nothing ever goes away until it has taught us what we need to know.” —
Pema Chodron

q: The wise man reads both books and life itself.
h:
“The wise man reads both books and life itself.” —
Lin Yutang

q: The desire for more positive experience is itself a negative experience.
h:
“The desire for more positive experience is itself a negative experience.” —
Mark Manson

q: Whatever is begun in anger, ends in shame.
h:
“Whatever is begun in anger, ends in shame.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: We don't stumble accidentally into an amazing life. It takes decision, a commitment to consistently work on ourselves.
h:
“We don't stumble accidentally into an amazing life. It takes decision, a commitment to consistently work on ourselves.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: Words are clothes that thoughts wear
h:
“Words are clothes that thoughts wear” —
Samuel Butler

q: Life is either a daring adventure, or it is nothing.
h:
“Life is either a daring adventure, or it is nothing.” —
Helen Keller

q: The more often a stupidity is repeated, the more it gets the appearance of wisdom.
h:
“The more often a stupidity is repeated, the more it gets the appearance of wisdom.” —
Voltaire

q: People think you're crazy if you talk about things they don't understand.
h:
“People think you're crazy if you talk about things they don't understand.” —
Elvis Presley

q: The pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity. The optimist sees opportunity in every difficulty.
h:
“The pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity. The optimist sees opportunity in every difficulty.” —
Winston Churchill

q: You will succeed because most people are lazy.
h:
“You will succeed because most people are lazy.” —
Shahir Zag

q: Let each man exercise the art he knows.
h:
“Let each man exercise the art he knows.” —
Aristophanes

q: There are two ways of seeing: with the body and with the soul. The body's sight can sometimes forget, but the soul remembers forever.
h:
“There are two ways of seeing: with the body and with the soul. The body's sight can sometimes forget, but the soul remembers forever.” —
Alexandre Dumas

q: Deeds will not be less valiant because they are upraised.
h:
“Deeds will not be less valiant because they are upraised.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Whatever you are, be a good one.
h:
“Whatever you are, be a good one.” —
Abraham Lincoln

q: You are never too old to become younger.
h:
“You are never too old to become younger.” —
Mae West

q: Our truest life is when we are in dreams awake.
h:
“Our truest life is when we are in dreams awake.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: Be grateful for what you have now, and nothing should be taken for granted.
h:
“Be grateful for what you have now, and nothing should be taken for granted.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Man invented language to satisfy his deep need to complain.
h:
“Man invented language to satisfy his deep need to complain.” —
Lily Tomlin

q: Laws are like cobwebs, which may catch small flies, but let wasps and hornets break through.
h:
“Laws are like cobwebs, which may catch small flies, but let wasps and hornets break through.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: There is no significance in life without struggle.
h:
“There is no significance in life without struggle.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: You were born to win, but to be a winner, you must plan to win, prepare to win, expect to win.
h:
“You were born to win, but to be a winner, you must plan to win, prepare to win, expect to win.” —
Arnold Schwarzenegger

q: Remember, today is the tomorrow you worried about yesterday.
h:
“Remember, today is the tomorrow you worried about yesterday.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: Incredible change happens in your life when you decide to take control of what you do have power over instead of craving control over what you don't.
h:
“Incredible change happens in your life when you decide to take control of what you do have power over instead of craving control over what you don't.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: All men are equal before fish.
h:
“All men are equal before fish.” —
Herbert Hoover

q: Before you embark on a journey of revenge, dig two graves.
h:
“Before you embark on a journey of revenge, dig two graves. ” —
Confucius

q: Nothing endures but change.
h:
“Nothing endures but change.” —
Heraclitus

q: A moving door hinge never corrodes. Flowing water never grows stagnant.
h:
“A moving door hinge never corrodes. Flowing water never grows stagnant.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: The greatest work that kindness does to others is that it makes them kind themselves.
h:
“The greatest work that kindness does to others is that it makes them kind themselves.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: Anyone telling you it's pointless to share your perspective is sharing their perspective.
h:
“Anyone telling you it's pointless to share your perspective is sharing their perspective.” —
Jack Butcher

q: Don't let the fear of losing be greater than the excitement of winning.
h:
“Don't let the fear of losing be greater than the excitement of winning.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.
h:
“Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: Patience is a form of wisdom. It demonstrates that we understand and accept the fact that sometimes things must unfold in their own time.
h:
“Patience is a form of wisdom. It demonstrates that we understand and accept the fact that sometimes things must unfold in their own time.” —
Jon Kabat-Zinn

q: A liar knows that he is a liar, but one who speaks mere portions of truth in order to deceive is a craftsman of destruction.
h:
“A liar knows that he is a liar, but one who speaks mere portions of truth in order to deceive is a craftsman of destruction.” —
Criss Jami

q: It is not uncommon for people to spend their whole life waiting to start living.
h:
“It is not uncommon for people to spend their whole life waiting to start living.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Riches don't make a man rich, they only make him busier.
h:
“Riches don't make a man rich, they only make him busier.” —
Christopher Columbus

q: Love doesn't need reason. It speaks from the irrational wisdom of the heart.
h:
“Love doesn't need reason. It speaks from the irrational wisdom of the heart.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Great thoughts speak only to the thoughtful mind, but great actions speak to all mankind.
h:
“Great thoughts speak only to the thoughtful mind, but great actions speak to all mankind.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Help others and give something back.
h:
“Help others and give something back.” —
Arnold Schwarzenegger

q: You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.
h:
“You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club. ” —
Jack London
